intro: Periploca parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered periploca, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring opposite, simple leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Periploca parviflora is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
